Pear Mr. Palmer:
Thank you for your letter of February 29. I have taken
the liberty of referring it to Mr. Robert Mott, Executive
Director, National Educational Radio, with the suggestion
that he consider it in the light of the importance of monitorÂ¬
ing service to non-commercial radio stations.
The applications for program assistance by the Corporation
ordinarily come to it from the non-commercial stations
requiring such asssistance. You will hear further from
Mr. Mott, or from us, as soon as he has had an opportunity
to consider your letter.
With every good wish.
Secretary-Treasurer
cc: Mr. Robert Mott
